DOC.brief_summary: To assess whether a combination of ciprofloxacin and adalimumab is more effective than adalimumab alone for the treatment of perianal fistulas in Crohn's disease
DOC.brief_title: Adalimumab in Combination With Ciprofloxacin/Placebo Treatment of Perianal Fistulas in Crohn's
DOC.detailed_description: Dutch multicenter, randomized, double-blind study with two arms. 146 patients will be included.
DOC.criteria: proven Crohn's disease Single or multiple draining perianal fistulas Abscesses Infliximab, cyclosporine, tacrolimus and antibiotics for Crohn's disease within past 3 months active viral infection significate cardiovascular dysfunction Pregnancy, Lactation Surgical bowel resection to be expected within 6 months Positive stool culture for enteric pathogens Total parental nutrition
